hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a significant news event (e.g., major exchange announcement, regulatory headline), a sharp, high-volume price move that is followed by 2-4 hours of compressed volatility (ATR(1h) < 50% of pre-spike 24h average) will lead to a continuation move in the original direction within the next 6 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-impact news creates a new information equilibrium. A period of low volatility after the initial spike suggests absorption and positioning, not exhaustion. The subsequent break often traps late reversers and attracts momentum algos.
entry_conditions: 1. Identify a >3% price move on 5-min candles with volume >200% of 20-period average.
2. Observe subsequent 2-4 hour period where 1h ATR contracts to <50% of its 24h pre-spike average.
3. Enter on a break of the high/low of the 2-hour consolidation range (depending on initial move direction) with volume confirmation (>150% of 20-period avg).

exit_conditions.take_profit: 1.5x the ATR of the initial spike move.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Other side of the consolidation range (high if short, low if long).
exit_conditions.time_exit: 6 hours after entry if TP/SL not hit.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the break of the consolidation range fails more than 55% of the time (i.e., leads to a whipsaw and reversal) over a sample of 50+ events across BTC and major alts.
